import { Playground } from 'docz';
import { useState } from 'react';

import ReactGlobe from './ReactGlobe';

# Animations

`react-globe` provides a simple way to execute globe animations through a series of steps. Simply pass an array of animation steps to the `animations` prop and `react-globe` will sequentially execute the animations. Each animation requires specifying the `animationDuration`, `coordinates`, `distanceRadiusScale` and `easingFunction`.

<Playground>
  {() => {
    const lookAt = [0, 30];
    const [animationSequence, setAnimationSequence] = useState();
    let animations = [];
    switch (animationSequence) {
      case 'Universal Studios':
        animations = [
          {
            animationDuration: 5000,
            coordinates: [1.3521, 103.8198],
            distanceRadiusScale: 2,
            easingFunction: ['Linear', 'None'],
          },
        ];
        break;
      case 'Travel Plans':
        animations = [
          {
            animationDuration: 5000,
            coordinates: [1.3521, 103.8198],
            distanceRadiusScale: 2,
            easingFunction: ['Linear', 'None'],
          },
          {
            animationDuration: 3000,
            coordinates: [39.9042, 116.4074],
            distanceRadiusScale: 2,
            easingFunction: ['Cubic', 'InOut'],
          },
          {
            animationDuration: 3000,
            coordinates: [37.773972, -122.431297],
            distanceRadiusScale: 2,
            easingFunction: ['Back', 'InOut'],
          },
          {
            animationDuration: 3000,
            coordinates: [40.73061, -73.935242],
            distanceRadiusScale: 2,
            easingFunction: ['Circular', 'InOut'],
          },
          {
            animationDuration: 3000,
            coordinates: [51.5074, 0.1278],
            distanceRadiusScale: 2,
            easingFunction: ['Quadratic', 'InOut'],
          },
          {
            animationDuration: 5000,
            coordinates: [1.3521, 103.8198],
            distanceRadiusScale: 4,
            easingFunction: ['Linear', 'None'],
          },
        ];
        break;
      default:
        animations = [];
    }
    return (
      <div>
        <button onClick={() => setAnimationSequence('Universal Studios')}>
          Universal Studios
        </button>
        <button onClick={() => setAnimationSequence('Travel Plans')}>
          Travel Plans
        </button>
        <ReactGlobe animations={animations} lookAt={lookAt} />
      </div>
    );
  }}
</Playground>
